title: Chamizal National Memorial: Things To Do
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Do             Things To Do | Actividades                   Browse the artwork               Step into the story               Watch a theater performance               Enjoy a picnic               Chat with a park ranger               Stroll along the trails            Chamizal National Memorial is open every day of the week. It is conveniently located in central El Paso, and the Chihuahuan Desert climate provides many days with great weather to enjoy a variety of outside activities. There is also plenty to see inside the Cultural Center. Take a look at the calendar for scheduled events. The exhibit, galleries and trails are all self-guided, but if you are bringing a large group or want to schedule a school field trip, it is best to plan ahead with a ranger. Museum Exhibit Did you know that this national memorial is situated on land that was part of Mexico until 1963? Learn why this memorial exists and how it came to be. Art Gallery Browse paintings, sculptures and other works by borderland artists. Some may be for sale. Performances Whether it's a concert, a play or a dance performance, something is happening on stage almost every weekend. Ranger Programs Join a park ranger for a walk, talk or activity to discover even more about Chamizal National Memorial. Trails Comfortable trails and green space provide an ideal place to get outside and recreate in the middle of El Paso. Biking Bring your bike for a workout or relaxation and stay for a while. Picnic Bring your meal and make a day of it.
